content.description:
The first 50 feet is broken dirty easy 5th class climbing up to the curving wide crack. 

  Climb another 100' up to a ledge with an agave right, after the 2nd bolt.   Rap 100' down to the right. Ears.
content.protection:
single run to 6", nuts 

  #6 size camalot mandatory for the first move.
content.location: Located on the far left side of the wall.

content.description: North Chimney separating Billy Goat Bluff from the main wall.   This is a full body wide crack. It does take some pro. Jeff called it .8. I have not lead it.
content.location: North Chimney separating Billy Goat Bluff from the main wall.   rap Billy Goat

content.description: On the far left side of the Ranger Danger cliff band is a detached block; "Billy Goat Bluff". It is viewable from the west side of town.    Billy Goat climbs a right leaning seam crack.
content.protection: P-1, .9 fingers and hands for 70'. Standard rack thru 2", nuts. Ears. Starts at small roof.   P-2 .10+ vertical layback seam with bulges. 140' sm nut(rp), a few med cams, 14 draws.   Two ropes needed to safely rap the route; rap down 130' to the right, on to a dirt ramp right of the first pitch.   There is a single shut 30' below the top, at the crux.
content.location: Located 3 miles up the trail, just before the turn-off to the Finger, and only a few hundred feet above the trail. On the far left side of the Ranger Danger cliff band is a detached 210' block; "Billy Goat Bluff". It is viewable from town.

content.description: This is the huge cliff band that runs north paralleling the Finger rock trail at about the 2 3/4 to 3 mile range. It can be seen from all over Tucson.   Maybe it has a name? Maybe this is where Trials and Tribulations is?   The west facing side is just above the trail as you work your way up, before the turn-off to the Finger, just before the trail hooks right and flattens out for a short time.
